person_say: I always procrastinate starting to write reports. What can help me get started?
animal_say: Buzz! It sounds like you’re stuck in procrastination with writing reports. Let’s dive in and explore what’s holding you back! Can you share your current excuse for not starting?

person_say: I think I just feel overwhelmed by the whole task. Like, I’m worried it won’t be good enough or that I won’t know how to start it right. It makes me want to just avoid it.
animal_say: Buzz buzz! Feeling overwhelmed can be tough, but I’m here to help! Do you think your worries are more about the fear of failing or not meeting your own expectations?

person_say: I think it’s both, honestly. I’m afraid of failing, but I also have these high expectations for myself, and that pressure makes it really hard to even start.
animal_say: Buzz! It sounds like you’re experiencing a mix of Fear of Failure and Fear of Success. Those high expectations can create a tough barrier! To shift your mindset, try setting smaller, achievable goals for yourself first. How about starting with just writing a single paragraph? Let’s break it down together!

person_say: That sounds like a good idea! Focusing on just one paragraph feels less overwhelming. I’ll try that approach! Any tips on how to make that first paragraph easier to write?
animal_say: Buzz buzz! To make that first paragraph easier, try brainstorming key ideas or points you want to include before you write. Jotting them down as bullet points can help clarify your thoughts! Then, just write without worrying about perfection; you can always edit later!

person_say: Thanks for the tips! Brainstorming bullet points sounds really helpful, and I like the idea of just writing without worrying about it being perfect right away. I’ll give it a try!
animal_say: Buzz! I'm so glad to hear you're feeling more confident! Remember, taking small steps makes a big difference. If you need more help or encouragement while you work, just let me know!

person_say: Thanks for your support! I'll definitely reach out if I need more help while I work on my report.
animal_say: Buzz buzz! I’m always here to cheer you on! Good luck with your report, and don't hesitate to come back if you need more tips or motivation. You've got this!
